title: High Maternal Mortality Rate
description: In 2023, Nigeria recorded a maternal mortality ratio of 993 per 100,000 live births, one of the highest globally.

title: Low Life Expectancy
description: As of 2023, the life expectancy at birth in Nigeria is 54.462 years, significantly lower than the global average.

title: High Prevalence of Communicable Diseases
description: In 2019, 65.21% of deaths in Nigeria were due to communicable diseases and maternal, prenatal, and nutrition conditions.

title: Low Investment in ICT
description: In 2023, Nigeria's investment in ICT with private participation was only $4,920,000, indicating limited growth in this sector.

title: Low Tobacco Use Among Adults
description: In 2022, only 3.3% of adults in Nigeria reported current tobacco use, one of the lowest rates globally.

title: Low Female Part-Time Employment
description: In 2016, only 1.49% of female employment in Nigeria was part-time, suggesting limited flexibility in work arrangements for women.

title: High Male Employment as Employers
description: In 2023, 26.34% of employed males in Nigeria were employers, indicating a significant entrepreneurial spirit among men.

title: Low Tobacco Use Among Males
description: In 2022, only 6.1% of male adults in Nigeria reported current tobacco use, reflecting a healthier lifestyle choice.

title: Limited Voice and Accountability
description: In 2023, Nigeria had 14 sources for voice and accountability, reflecting challenges in democratic processes and citizen engagement.

title: Low Female Life Expectancy
description: In 2023, the life expectancy for females in Nigeria was 54.743 years, highlighting health and social challenges.
